newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen falling.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee ended 0.10 down at 42.25 to the dollar in the kerb market on Thursday on strong amid fears of another downward adjustment of the Pakistani currency, dealers said.
"During the last three days, the rupee shed more than two percent in the kerb market against the dollar as there are fears of its another downward adjustment," dealer Owais Kalia said.

The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, changed on May 23, was 40.3900/40.5920 against the dollar. The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed unchanged at 4.20 percent. -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192
